post.description: Stores all events in the request atomically. All events must refer to the same aggregate id.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: aggregateType
parameters.description: The aggregate type.

parameters.name: aggregateId
parameters.description: The unique id of the aggregate

parameters.name: eventBatch
parameters.description: Batch of one or more events

400.description: Invalid aggregate type or field name.

409.description: Conflict due to expected version mismatch.

examples.message: Cannot create new aggregate with ID [745bddb1-e63b-4b19-82ee-b28ab399b56f] and type [order] as it already exists

errors: events size must be between 1 and 64

post.description: Bulk stores all events in the request atomically. All events must refer to unique aggregate ids.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: aggregateType
parameters.description: The aggregate type.

parameters.name: bulk
parameters.description: Bulk of one or more batches

400.description: Invalid aggregate type or field name.

409.description: Conflict due to expected version mismatch.

examples.message: Cannot create new aggregate with ID [745bddb1-e63b-4b19-82ee-b28ab399b56f] and type [order] as it already exists

errors: events size must be between 1 and 64

delete.description: Permanently delete all aggregates, including all events, for given aggregate type.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: aggregateType
parameters.description: The aggregate type

parameters.name: deleteToken
parameters.description: Valid delete token. Will be included in the response of the first DELETE request.

200.description: The generated temporary delete token needed to permanently delete all aggregates. The token will be valid for ten minutes and must be passed as a query parameter to trigger the delete of all the aggregates.

schema.description: The delete token, valid for ten minutes.

204.description: If delete token was valid and the aggregate was successfully deleted.

403.description: If delete token was invalid or expired.

get.description: List aggregates to get the current version and last updated time.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: aggregateType
parameters.description: The aggregate type

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Optional number to start from

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional limit. Default is 1000.

hasMore.description: Indicates if there are more summaries available.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: aggregateType
parameters.description: The aggregate type

parameters.name: aggregateId
parameters.description: The unique id of the aggregate

delete.description: Permanently delete an aggregate, including all events.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: aggregateType
parameters.description: The aggregate type

parameters.name: aggregateId
parameters.description: The unique id of the aggregate

parameters.name: deleteToken
parameters.description: Valid delete token. Will be included in the response to the first DELETE request.

200.description: The generated temporary delete token needed to permanently delete the aggregate. The token will be valid for ten minutes and must be passed as a query parameter to trigger the delete of the aggregate.

schema.description: The delete token, valid for ten minutes.

204.description: If delete token was valid and the aggregate was successfully deleted.

403.description: If delete token was invalid or expired.

get.summary: Load all events for an aggregate
get.description: By loading all events for a single aggregate we can derive the current state.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: aggregateType
parameters.description: The aggregate type

parameters.name: aggregateId
parameters.description: The unique id of the aggregate

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Optional version number to start from

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional version limit. Default is 1000.

parameters.name: includeMetadata
parameters.description: Adds timestamp and aggregateVersion to the response.

schema.description: The aggregate containing all its events, since the beginning of time.

aggregateVersion.description: Current aggregate version. Can be passed as 'expectedVersion' on next update to enable optimistic concurrency control.

hasMore.description: Indicates if there are more versions available.

examples.message: Unable to find aggregate with ID [b836e27d-6107-40f6-abb2-ae2e9d2815ba], type [order]

get.description: Overview showing number of batches, aggregates and events per aggregate type.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

head.description: Get current global sequence number at head for all feeds

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

get.summary: Get feed of events for all types
get.description: Get all events for all aggregates for all types (feed names). The payload is returned with the event batches in insertion order, each with a unique sequence number.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Optional sequence number to start from (exclusive)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional response limit. Default is 1000.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 date-time string to start from, inclusive, eg. 2017-07-21T17:32:28.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 date-time string to stop at, exclusive, eg. 2017-07-21T17:32:28.

parameters.name: partitionCount
parameters.description: The expected total number of partitions, i.e. the total number of consumers feeding in parallel.

parameters.name: partitionNumber
parameters.description: The partition number to request.

parameters.name: waitTime
parameters.description: If provided, will generate a long-polling request. This is the maximum time (in ms) to wait before responding. Maximum value is 60000.

parameters.name: filterType
parameters.description: If provided, filters the feed on the given aggregate types. Provide multiple values to filter on more than one aggregate type.

get.summary: Get total number of event batches
get.description: Get the total number of event batches.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 date-time string to start from, inclusive, eg. 2017-07-21T17:32:28.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 date-time string to stop at, exclusive, 2017-07-21T17:32:28.

head.description: Get current sequence number at head for a given feed

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the feed

Serialized-SequenceNumber-Current.description: Current sequence number at feed head

get.description: Get all events for all aggregates given a type (feed name). The payload is returned with the event batches in insertion order, each with a unique sequence number.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the feed (aggregate type)

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Optional sequence number to start from, exclusive.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional response limit. Default is 1000.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 date-time string to start from, inclusive, eg. 2017-07-21T17:32:28.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 date-time string to stop at, exclusive, 2017-07-21T17:32:28.

parameters.name: partitionCount
parameters.description: The expected total number of partitions, i.e. the total number of consumers feeding in parallel.

parameters.name: partitionNumber
parameters.description: The partition number to request.

parameters.name: waitTime
parameters.description: If provided, will generate a long-polling request. This is the maximum time (in ms) to wait before responding. Maximum value is 60000.

get.summary: Get total number of event batches
get.description: Get the number of event batches for a given aggregate type (feed name).

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the feed (aggregate type)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 date-time string to start from, inclusive, eg. 2017-07-21T17:32:28.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Optional ISO 8601 date-time string to stop at, exclusive, 2017-07-21T17:32:28.

parameters.name: Serialized-Tenant-Id
parameters.description: The optional ID of the tenant.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status to filter. Possible values are: SCHEDULED, READY, ONGOING, COMPLETED, CANCELED, FAILED.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of entries to skip

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of entries to include in response. Default is 10.

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: Reference string to filter on. See JsonPath 'setref' for details.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Filter reference value from. Usable if reference is a date or timestamp.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Filter reference value to. Usable if reference is a date or timestamp.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: String to search for. The projection has to be created with 'indexedFields'.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort string. Any combination of the following fields: projectionId, reference, createdAt, updatedAt. Add '+' and '-' prefixes to indicate ascending/descending sort order. Ascending order is default.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of entries to skip

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of entries to include in response. Default is 100.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: If provided, filters on the projection id(s) to only get the specified projections. Provide multiple values to retrieve multiple projections in the response.

expectedVersion.description: Optional version number enabling optimistic concurrency control in a multi-threaded scenario.
Optional version number enabling optimistic concurrency control in a multi-threaded scenario.

eventId.description: Optional eventId. Will be generated if omitted.

data.description: Optional user defined event data map

encryptedData.description: Optional client-side encrypted payload. Max 65535 bytes.

hasMore.description: Indicates if there are more definitions available.

aggregated.description: Dictates whether the definition should result in one projection per aggregate type or one projection per aggregateId.

signingSecret.description: The secret key used to HMAC sign the requests. Only applicable in combination with the use of external/custom event projectors.

idField.description: Field in the event to use as the projection id. Defaults to the aggregate id.

description.example: Projects fully paid orders ready to be shipped

reference.description: Optional external tenant reference, e.g. a customer number or similar.

deleted.description: Indicates if the tenant was deleted.

eventType.description: Event type to match the handler against

functionUri.description: URI pointing to function when using external event projector.

idField.description: Field in the event to use as the projection id. Defaults to the aggregate id.

functions.description: The functions to apply for matching events. Will run in specified order

function.description: The name of the function to apply

targetSelector.description: The selector for the target of the function

eventSelector.description: The selector for the event data to use as source

rawData.description: The raw data to use as input to the function, if applicable

targetFilter.description: The target filter determining which state the projection should be for the event to be applied

eventFilter.description: Filter for the events, determining for which events the function should be applied

hasMore.description: Indicates if there are more projections available.

projectionId.description: The projection id. Will be a UUID if type 'single' and a string if type 'aggregated'.

hasMore.description: Indicates if there are more definitions available.

description.example: Reaction that sends an email when a payment has been processed

cancelOnEventTypes.description: Event types to cancel reaction scheduled in the future

triggerTimeField.description: Optional path to event data field containing trigger time. If not specified, trigger time will be ASAP. Dot notation supported.

offset.description: Optional trigger time offset. Defined in the ISO-8601 duration format (PnDTnHnMn.nS). May be negative.

Action.description: See documentation for details on which field combinations are valid: https://serialized.io/docs/reactions/api-reference

signingSecret.description: The secret key used to HMAC sign the requests.

aggregated.description: True if the projection is aggregated, false if single.

running.description: True if the projector engine is actively feeding new entries.

atHead.description: True if the projection engine has reached head at least once, i.e. a replay has been done.

hasMore.description: Indicates if there are more events available.
